title: NRL player Joel Thompson suffers serious injuries and is rushed to hospital after collapsing
text:
An NRL player has been airlifted to hospital after he smashed his head on a rock.

Joel Thompson uploaded a startling image to his Instagram on Wednesday showing a huge stapled gash on his head with blood spread across his pillow.

The veteran player was rushed to Gosford Hospital in an ambulance before he was airlifted to Royal North Shore Hospital in north Sydney.

Joel Thompson uploaded a startling image to his Instagram on Wednesday showing a huge stapled gash on his head with blood spread across his pillow

In the image he appears barely conscious with oxygen tube placed in his mouth, wearing a neck brace and what appears to be fluids forcibly entering his system through a drip.

'Hey everyone I've had a real bad accident - won't be talking to anyone for another week,' Thompson wrote.

'Big lesson learnt around drinking and partying. Thinking of you all.'

The Manly Sea Eagles forward spoke to the Daily Telegraph and said the horrific injuries were the result of a mishap when he was partying with friends.

'I just caught up with mates and rolled down a big hill until I hit a rocky end,' he said.

'My head hit it hard and I didn't think I'd survive. But I've come through it.'

Thompson said he still needed to concentrate on getting better as he was not yet in the clear.

The veteran player was rushed to Gosford Hospital in an ambulance before he was airlifted to Royal North Shore Hospital and said he is now focusing on recovering - Pictured with wife Amy Thompson

'My only concern is for my family and letting them know I am OK,' Thompson said.

The veteran rugby league player reiterated that it was a teachable moment to him.

Thompson was suffering a broken arm and was not able to play at the Koori Knockout tournament on the Central Coast but still attended with fellow injured players.

In 2016 the veteran forward was awarded the Ken Stephen Award for his extensive promotion and involvement with mental health off the field.

Thompson has played nearly over 220 games professionally and will remain with Manly for a third year.

authors: Tom Place For Daily Mail Australia
